that you are the lord of the people.
you don’t think of them as anything.
when the sun has gone down.
Your relatives have approved of you,
By what restraint do you stand
By what do they not transgress you,
I respectfully pay homage to them,

original: pāde vandāmi tādinaṁ.🔽Te maṁ dhammaguṇe yuttaṁ,🔽sussūsamanusūyakaṁ;
analyzed: pāde vandāmi tādina  te mama dhamma guṇe yutta  sussūsamanusūyaka
translated: I bow to the feet of those who are such.🔽The ascetics, the teachers of men,
the sages who delight in the qualities of the Dhamma,🔽encourage me,
who is devoted to the qualities of the Dhamma.

analyzed: dhamme me nirataḥ mano  hattha ārohā anīkaṭṭhā
translated: my mind is devoted to the Dhamma.🔽The elephant riders, the charioteers,
which is full of meat and liquor.
And also there are prosperous merchants,
I have provided protection for them,
so know that this is the Uposatha.”
“By the Dhamma, it seems, you rule
and also a benefactor to your relatives.
That which is surrounded by relatives,
just as the lord of the asuras cannot overcome Indra.”
The Jātaka of Saṁvara, the eighth.
